basics.name: Guolin Yin
basics.label: Researcher and Data Scientist
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in Device-Free Wireless Sensing at the University of Liverpool with extensive experience in AI, Wi-Fi sensing, and data science.

work.name: University of Liverpool
work.summary: Leading an EPSRC-funded project on radio frequency fingerprint identification (RFFI), developing AI models for RF signatures to enhance communication and IoT security.
highlights: Collaborating with academic partners and industry partners such as MathWorks.
Developing security solutions using advanced AI techniques.

work.name: SC Solutions AI
work.summary: Led a team of five members in an Innovate UK project, developing AI and remote sensing applications for agriculture.
highlights: Developed models for crop growth prediction, classification, and biomass estimation.
Achieved higher accuracy than traditional methods at lower costs.

work.name: University of Liverpool
work.summary: Assisted in teaching data-focused subjects such as machine learning and statistics, as well as hardware-related topics like electronic circuit design and communication systems.

publications.name: FewSense: Towards a Scalable and Cross-domain Wi-Fi Sensing System Using Few-shot Learning
publications.summary: Proposed a few-shot learning-based system to address scalability and domain dependency in Wi-Fi sensing systems.

publications.name: Adversarial Attacks Against Deep Learning-based Wi-Fi Sensing Systems and Countermeasures
publications.summary: Studied adversarial attacks in Wi-Fi sensing systems and proposed countermeasures.

awards.title: Hong Kong and Tung Postgraduate Scholarships
